parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.46

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Markers

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns marker position. See also [[setMarkerPos]].

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[markerPos]] markerName

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> markerName: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - format [x, y, '''0''']

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> [[markerPos]] [markerName, preserveElevation] <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.93</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> [markerName, preserveElevation]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> markerName: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> preserveElevation: [[Boolean]] (Optional, default [[false]])

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Array]] - format [[PositionAGL]] if ''preserveElevation'' is [[true]] or [x, y, '''0'''] if ''preserveElevation'' is [[false]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_mPos1 = [[markerPos]] "markerOne";</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_mPos2 = [[markerPos]] ["markerTwo", [[true]]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setMarkerPos]], [[setMarkerPosLocal]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on September 1, 2016 - 12:42 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Demellion|Demellion]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
To accomplish getting the altitude of a marker before the alternative syntax introduced in A3 v1.93, you can do a workaround using [[setMarkerDir]] as it accepts any number (above 360 or below -360):
<code>"myMarker" [[setMarkerPos]] [200, 200];
"myMarker" [[setMarkerDir]] 1640;</code>

After, setting player position as an example:
<code>[[player]] [[setPosASL]] [([[markerPos]] "myMarker") [[select]] 0, ([[markerPos]] "myMarker") [[select]] 1, ([[markerDir]] "myMarker")]</code>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
